WizardTD

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • WizardTD.Entity
      • WizardTD.Enemy

  • public class Enemy
extends Entity
    The Enemy class extends the entity class. It follows a predefined path and can take damage.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class WizardTD.Entity

        sprite, x, y

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Enemy(MonsterData monsterData, java.util.List<Tile> path)
      Creates a new instance of Enemy using the monsterData provided in the JSON file and a path represented by a series of Tiles to follow.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void banish()
      Resets the enemy's position to its initial point and deducts the game's current Mana by the enemy's current hit points.
      void freeze()
      Sets the boolean isFrozen to true;
      float getCurrentHitPoints()
      Returns the current hit points of the enemy.
      float getMaxHitPoints()
      Returns the maximum hit points of the enemy.
      boolean isAlive()
      Checks if enemy is alive.
      boolean isFreeze()
      Checks if the enemy is currently frozen.
      boolean isPlayingDeathAnimation()
      Checks if the enemy is currently playing a death animation.
      void move()
      Moves the enemy along the predefined path.
      void takeDamage(float damage)
      Enemy takes damage thus reducing its hit points.
      void tick()
      Updates enemy's state every tick, by calling move() in order to move and checking if the enemy is frozen, dead, or playing death animation.

      • Methods inherited from class WizardTD.Entity

        draw, getX, getY, setSprite

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(MonsterData monsterData,
             java.util.List<Tile> path)
        Creates a new instance of Enemy using the monsterData provided in the JSON file and a path represented by a series of Tiles to follow.
        Parameters:
        monsterData - The data for the enemy, including type, HP, speed, etc.
        path - The path of Tiles that the instance of enemy will follow.

    • Method Detail

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(float damage)
        Enemy takes damage thus reducing its hit points.
        Parameters:
        damage - The amount of damage dealt to the enemy.

      • getCurrentHitPoints

        public float getCurrentHitPoints()
        Returns the current hit points of the enemy.
        Returns:
        The current hit points of the enemy.

      • getMaxHitPoints

        public float getMaxHitPoints()
        Returns the maximum hit points of the enemy. The amount of hit points it starts with.
        Returns:
        The maximum hit points of the enemy.

      • isPlayingDeathAnimation

        public boolean isPlayingDeathAnimation()
        Checks if the enemy is currently playing a death animation.
        Returns:
        True if the enemy is playing a death animation, otherwise false.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Checks if enemy is alive.
        Returns:
        True if enemy is alive, otherwise false.

      • banish

        public void banish()
        Resets the enemy's position to its initial point and deducts the game's current Mana by the enemy's current hit points.

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves the enemy along the predefined path.

      • freeze

        public void freeze()
        Sets the boolean isFrozen to true;

      • isFreeze

        public boolean isFreeze()
        Checks if the enemy is currently frozen.
        Returns:
        True if the enemy is frozen, otherwise false.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Updates enemy's state every tick, by calling move() in order to move and checking if the enemy is frozen, dead, or playing death animation.
